page.title: 19WATER RECLAMATION WORKS
page.content: WATER RECLAMATION WORKS [[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[ The water reclamation works (sewage farm)first started in 1960.The sewage works employ three people altogether. It serves the village of East Bridgford only. THE PROCESS [[[[[[[[[[[ When the dirty water arrives at the sewage works it is filtered in three different stages.Screens remove large pieces of rubbish.Then the sewage is passed through sedimentation tanks to remove solid matter which is called sludge.Finally, the dirty liquid is sprayed on to a filter bed where tiny organisms living on the surface of the stones digest the sewage and the remaining liquid is recycled into the River Trent.
